intro: Mespilodaphne prolifera, commonly known as the creeping mespilodaphne, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurel and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a glossy, dark green appearance. It produces small, fragrant flowers followed by spherical, berry-like fruits that are typically green when mature.
